titleStmt.title: R. W. Park to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2852

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Elizabethtown Ky
June 26 1862
Hon Beriah MaGoffin
Governor of Ky
Sir

The Police Judge of this place who was elected at the April election 1860 failing to qualify & refusing to do so, at a Meeting of the board of Trustees held the following order was adopted "Monday June 23 It appearing to the board of Trustees that the office of Police Judge of Elizabethtown is now vacant. It is ordered that James D Culey be recommended to the Governor of Kentucky as a suitable person to fill said office"
You will please Send his commission as soon as possible

R. M. Park
President, Board Trustees
Elizabethtown
